newsitem.title: DENMARK: France Telecom Mobile wins Danish DCS-1800 licence.
newsitem.headline: France Telecom Mobile wins Danish DCS-1800 licence.

text.p: France Telecom Mobile was one of five bidders awarded Danish DCS-1800 mobile telephone licences on Wednesday, the Danish National Telecoms agency said.
Apart from France Telecom Mobile, three other operators were awarded Danish licences, Denmark's Tele Danmark and Sonofon and Sweden's Telia.
The fifth bidder was Swedish Netcom Systems.
"The latest licensing round has created the basis for the lowest tariffs yet seen in Denmark for users of mobile telephones," the agency said in a statement.
"The DCS-1800 is based on GSM technology but allows several different operators to enter the market," it said. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969652
